title: Kim Jung-kyum
text:
Kim Jung-Kyum (born 9 June 1976) is a South Korean retired <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>.
He represented the national team in 7 matches and also formerly played for <a href="Chunnam%20Dragons">Chunnam Dragons</a>, <a href="Jeonbuk%20Hyundai%20Motors">Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors</a> and <a href="Pohang%20Steelers">Pohang Steelers</a> in the South Korean <a href="K-League">K-League</a>.
Club career.
Kim Jung-kyum joined to <a href="Chunnam%20Dragons">Chunnam Dragons</a> in 1999, after has contributed to the <a href="Korean%20FA%20Cup%202003">2003 Korean FA Cup</a> runner-up. In 2005, <a href="Jeonbuk%20Hyundai%20Motors">Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors</a> agreed a player swap with <a href="Park%20Jae-hong%20%28footballer%20born%201978%29">Park Jae-hong</a> going in the opposite direction, after has contributed to the win for <a href="Korean%20FA%20Cup%202005">2005 Korean FA Cup</a> and <a href="AFC%20Champions%20League%202006">2006 AFC Champions League</a>. In 2008, he moved to <a href="Pohang%20Steelers">Pohang Steelers</a>. On 2 June 2011, his club Pohang terminated the contract with him for betting on League Cup match after receiving a tip-off from an opposition player involved in the match-fixing.
International career.
Between 2003 and 2004, Kim Jung-Kyum won a total of 7 international caps for the <a href="South%20Korea%20national%20football%20team">South Korea national team</a>.
He made his <a href="South%20Korea%20national%20football%20team">South Korea national team</a> debut on 25 September 2003 in a A-match against <a href="Vietnam%20national%20football%20team">Vietnam</a> at the <a href="2004%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup%20qualification">2004 AFC Asian Cup qualification</a>, who played for <a href="2004%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">2004 AFC Asian Cup</a>.
Honours.
Club.
Chunnam Dragons
Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors
Pohang Steelers
